info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 31 at 3:29PM MDT until May 31 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MDT FOR NORTHEASTERN CHAVES COUNTY... At 328 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located 9 miles northwest of Bitter Lake Wildlife Refuge and also about 7 miles east southeast of the Refuge, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Chaves County. This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 121 and 140. Highway 380 between Mile Markers 169 and 193. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
